_header: Thou fierce god of arms Mars the red
Note: Includes at lines 211-350 ‘Anelida’s Complaint’, which is also found separately: see 4949.
Subjects: complaints, lovers’; lover’s lament; women, as speakers/narrators
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, Anelida and Arcite — 357 lines in 45 stanzas of various forms, mostly rhyme royal

Bod638.First Lines:
The fers god of Armes Mars the redethat in the frosty contre callid
                    trace…
Bod638.Last Lines:
…And with her owne hond she gan hit write& sent hit to her
                    theban knght Arcyte
Bod638.Note: ‘Anelida’s Complaint’ (4949) occurs before 5823 in this MS .
Bod638.Attributed Title:
The boke of feyre Anelida & fals
                    Arcyte (f. 7v), So thrillyd with the poynt . vt supra et
                        cetera (at the end).
Bod638.Facsimiles:
Robinson,  Pamela. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Manuscript Bodley 638: A Facsimile.
         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, and Woodbridge: Boydell and Brewer, 1982.
Bod638.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             A Supplementary Parallel-Text Edition of Chaucer’s Minor
                Poems.
             2 vols. 
             Chaucer Society
         1st ser. 22, 59. London: Trübner, n.d.; repr. New York and London:
            Johnson, 1967.

BodDig181.First Lines:
Thowe fers god of Armes Mars the redeThat in thy ffrosty Cuntre
                    called Trace…
BodDig181.Last Lines:
…With in the Temple with a sorowfull chereThat Shapyn was as
                    ye shall aftir here
BodDig181.Attributed Title: Explicit lamentacio Annelide Regine Ermonie (at the end)

BodFair16.First Lines:
Thou fers god of Armes Mars the redethat in the frosty contre
                    called Trace…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…and with her ovne honde she gan hit writeAnd sent to her
                    theban knyght Arcite…
BodFair16.Note:
Ends incomplete after 30 stanzas, with note for continuance, ‘So
                    thirled with the poynt & cetera’ in display script at end (f
                    .35)
BodFair16.Attributed Title: The compleynt of feire Anelida And fals Arcite (f. 32)

BodTan346.First Lines:
Thou ferse god of armes Mars the redeThat in thi firsty contre
                    called Trace…
BodTan346.Last Lines:
…With Iune the temple with a sorofull chereThat shapyn was as
                    ye shall aftyr here
BodTan346.Attributed Title:
Of Qu. Annelida & þe false Arcite (f. 59v, added by
                    post-medieval hand)
BodTan346.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.

             3 vols. 
             Chaucer Society
         1st. ser. 21, 57, 58. London: Trübner, n.d. repr. New York and
            London: Johnson, 1967.

BLAdd16165.First Lines:
þow fers god of armes mars þe redþat in þy
                    frosty cuntrey called Trace…
BLAdd16165.Last Lines:
…How þat Arcyte Anelyda so soreHope thirlled with þe
                    poynte of Remembraunce
BLAdd16165.Attributed Title:
Balade of Anelyda Qwene of Cartage made by Geffrey Chaucyer (f.
                        256v); And þus endiþe here þe compleynte of
                    Anelyda (243v)
BLAdd16165.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             A Supplementary Parallel-Text Edition of Chaucer’s Minor
                Poems.
             2 vols. 
             Chaucer Society
         1st ser. 22, 59. London: Trübner, n.d.; repr. New York and London:
            Johnson, 1967.

BLAdd17492.First Lines:
…for thowgh I had yow to morow agayneI myght as well hold
                    apryl from rayneas holde yow to maken stedfast…
BLAdd17492.Last Lines:
…ys that a tame beest that ys aye fayneto renne away whan he
                    ys lefte agaste…

BLHar372.First Lines:
[T]How ferse god of Armes Marce the reedethat in the frosty contre
                    called Trace…
BLHar372.Last Lines:
…How that Arcyte Annelyda to soorehath thrilled with þe
                    poynt of Remembraunce
BLHar372.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth the / Compleynt of faire / Anelida & fals Arcite (f.
                    57)
BLHar372.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.

             3 vols. 
             Chaucer Society
         1st. ser. 21, 57, 58. London: Trübner, n.d. repr. New York and
            London: Johnson, 1967.

BLHar7333.First Lines:
Þow fiers god of armes mars the redeThat in þe frosty
                    contry called Trace…
BLHar7333.Last Lines:
…How þat Arcyte Anelyda so soreHaþe trilled with
                    þe poynte of Rememberaunce
BLHar7333.Attributed Title:
Lo my lordis and ladyes here folowyng may ye see / the maner of the lovyng
                    bytwene Arcite of / Thebes and Anelida the faire Quene of hermony / which with
                    his feyned chere doublenesse and / flateryng disceuied here withouten cause she
                    / beyng than oon of þe trewest gentilwomen / that bere lyf compleyneth here
                    I beseche you (f. 134ra, rubric)
BLHar7333.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,

Longleat258.First Lines:
[O]thou fers god of Armes the RedeThat in thy frosty Countrey
                    called trace…
Longleat258.Last Lines:
…Within the Temple with a woful chereThat shapen was as ye may
                    plainly here
Longleat258.Attributed Title:
Here endith the complaint of / Annelada the quene ayeinst fals / Arcite the
                    Theban knyght (f. 84)
Longleat258.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             A Supplementary Parallel-Text Edition of Chaucer’s Minor
                Poems.
             2 vols.

         1st ser. 22, 59. London: Trübner, n.d.; repr. New York and London:
            Johnson, 1967.
